advice.advice: Try and create an evening routine, stop doing work by a certain time, avoid looking at bright lights or screens an hour before bed. Take time to wind down before, this might be reading a book, listening to music, or even creating a plan/to do list if this helps you get ideas down on paper.
If possible, try to avoid napping during the day and avoid drinking caffeinated drinks too close to bedtime.
advice.external: Suggestions of different uncaffinated drinks to try?

advice.advice: Make sure you have a quiet and peaceful environment, it’s ideal if you can leave work based things in a different room to the one you sleep in but failing that keep things at a desk rather than working in bed
Exercise can often help with sleep. Find what works for you, it might be that gentle exercise in the evening will help you settle down.
advice.external: Try the https://www.strava.com/ app to keep track of exercise and keep motivation up

advice.advice: If you’re feeling restless when trying to sleep, try something that you find relaxing, such as reading a book or listening to music.

advice.advice: Take time out of your day to have breakfast, lunch and dinner. Try to reduce over snacking or eating quick bites to eat as these are not as satisfying and will reduce the quality of your diet
Try to include lots of fruit, vegetables and fibre in your diet which will improve both physical and mental health
advice.external: Article on how to have a sustainable diet

advice.advice: Plan your meals ahead. Have a look at online recipes which suggest quick and healthy meals. This will also make your shopping more cost efficient and easier.
advice.external: Get some recipe ideas from www.bbcgoodfood.com

serious: If you would like more support with relationships, check out the relate website at: www.relate.org.uk

advice.advice: Plan activities with your loved ones. Even if it’s just an hour a week, it’s really important to create a balance. Having a planned activity- e.g. cooking your favourite food together- will create something to look forward to, and reduce the likelihood that you’ll run out of time.
advice.external: Get some recipe ideas from www.bbcgoodfood.com

advice.advice: Make sure you take your allotted annual leave. You are entitled to take time away from work!
